data.question: What is water pollution?
data.answerA: chemically contaminated waste water that kills people
data.answerB: "any chemical, physical or biological change in the quality of water that has a harmful effect on any living thing that drinks or uses or lives (in) it"
data.answerC: biologically contaminated water that harms and/or kills living beings

data.question: Why is water so easy to contaminate?
data.answerA: because water is able to dissolve more substances than any other liquid on earth
data.answerB: because water covers 70% of the earth and is polluted by factories
data.answerC: because water gets contaminated by humans and animals

data.question: "What percentage of the lakes in the US are too polluted for fishing, aquatic life, or swimming?"
How is water pollution detected?
data.answerA: testing water for contaminants and watching for sources to dry up
data.answerB: analizing water samples in labs and by observation of changes in the living organisms in the water
data.answerC: by observation of living organism actually dying in the water

data.question: What is heat pollution or thermal pollution of water?
data.answerA: "is pollution caused by airplanes that heat clouds, causing hotter rain and warming the atmosphere"
data.answerB: "is the pollution caused by livestock, whose waste is buried and contaminates the groundwater"
data.answerC: "is the pollution caused by factories that release hot water into naturally cold streams, rivers and streams as part of their production processes"

data.question: Groundwater pollution is dramatic. Once contaminated, an aquifer can be unusable for...?
Which is the top source of contamination in rivers and streams in the US?
How is drinking water regulated in the US?
data.answerA: Public water systems are regualted by the US Drug and Food Administration (FDA).
data.answerB: All public water systems in the US follow the regulations set by the U. S. Environmental Protection (EPA).
data.answerC: Each city Municipality regulates the administration of public water systems and also set quality standards.

data.question: Does EPA regulate wells?
data.answerB: "No, EPA does not regulate private wells."
